channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Opinion: A little league heartbreak
item.description: The State Department denied one Venezuelan Little League team entry into the U.S., but allowed another. NPR's Scott Simon questions how the sports exemption to Trump's travel ban is being applied.
item.content:encoded:
The State Department denied one Venezuelan Little League team entry into the U.S., but allowed another. NPR's Scott Simon questions how the sports exemption to Trump's travel ban is being applied.

(Image credit: Dylan Buell/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: How surgeons build a new bladder for cancer patients like Deion Sanders
item.description: University of Colorado football coach Deion Sanders announced he got a new bladder this week as part of his cancer treatment. Here's how doctors construct a new bladder from a patient's small intestine.
item.content:encoded:
University of Colorado football coach Deion Sanders announced he got a new bladder this week as part of his cancer treatment. Here's how doctors construct a new bladder from a patient's small intestine.

(Image credit: AAron Ontiveroz/MediaNews Group)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Boden

item.title: Millions of Ukrainians abroad hope to return home once Russia's invasion ends
item.description: Some Ukrainians have already returned after fleeing Russia's invasion, and almost half of the more than 5 million still abroad want to, according to a survey this year.
item.content:encoded:
Some Ukrainians have already returned after fleeing Russia's invasion, and almost half of the more than 5 million still abroad want to, according to a survey this year.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage)
item.dc:creator: Claire Harbage

item.title: If compliments make you feel super awkward, this comic is for you
item.description: When someone says something nice about us, it can make us feel awkward and uncomfortable. Researchers explain the science behind those emotions — and make the case for accepting genuine praise.
item.content:encoded: When someone says something nice about us, it can make us feel awkward and uncomfortable. Researchers explain the science behind those emotions — and make the case for accepting genuine praise.
item.dc:creator: Andee Tagle

item.title: Art of the praise: Why flattering Trump is now the go-to diplomatic move
item.description: World leaders have lavished praise on President Trump in order to smooth diplomatic relations — and get better deals too.
item.content:encoded:
World leaders have lavished praise on President Trump in order to smooth diplomatic relations — and get better deals too.

(Image credit: Jabin Botsford)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Appeals court keeps order blocking indiscriminate immigration sweeps
item.description: A federal appeals court ruled Friday to uphold a lower court's temporary order blocking the Trump administration from conducting indiscriminate immigration stops and arrests in Southern California.
item.content:encoded:
A federal appeals court ruled Friday to uphold a lower court's temporary order blocking the Trump administration from conducting indiscriminate immigration stops and arrests in Southern California.

(Image credit: Jae C. Hong)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 3 big takeaways from the NTSB hearing on the DCA midair collision
item.description: A three-day National Transportation Safety Board hearing on the deadliest U.S. aviation accident in decades dug into problems with altimeters, chopper routes and the busy Washington, D.C., airspace.
item.content:encoded:
A three-day National Transportation Safety Board hearing on the deadliest U.S. aviation accident in decades dug into problems with altimeters, chopper routes and the busy Washington, D.C., airspace.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: States sue Trump administration after more hospitals stop treating transgender youth
item.description: A coalition of 16 states and D.C. argue in the lawsuit that the Trump administration is trying to effectuate a national ban on gender-affirming care for youth by intimidating hospitals and doctors.
item.content:encoded:
A coalition of 16 states and D.C. argue in the lawsuit that the Trump administration is trying to effectuate a national ban on gender-affirming care for youth by intimidating hospitals and doctors. 

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: A pediatrician working in Gaza on how she finds the will to keep going
item.description: Dr. Seema Jilani is a pediatrician who has been providing medical care to children in Gaza.
item.content:encoded: Dr. Seema Jilani is a pediatrician who has been providing medical care to children in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Aslam

item.title: States sue Trump administration over its actions against gender-affirming health care
item.description: Today 16 states and the District of Columbia filed a lawsuit in support of children's hospitals and doctors that have provided gender-affirming care for minors, contending the Trump administration has acted illegally in pressuring doctors and children's hospitals to stop.
item.content:encoded: Today 16 states and the District of Columbia filed a lawsuit in support of children's hospitals and doctors that have provided gender-affirming care for minors, contending the Trump administration has acted illegally in pressuring doctors and children's hospitals to stop.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bolton
